title: May 14, 2024—KB5037788 (OS Build 10240.20651) - Microsoft Support
text:
May 14, 2024—KB5037788 (OS Build 10240.20651) 
Windows 10

For information about Windows update terminology, see the article about the  
types of Windows updates 
 and the  
monthly quality update types 
. For an overview of Windows 10, version 1507, see its  
update history page 
. 
Highlights 
This update supports the currency change in Croatia from the kuna to the euro. 
Improvements 
This security update includes quality improvements. When you install this KB: 
This update addresses an issue that might affect domain controllers (DC). NTLM authentication traffic might increase. 
If you installed earlier updates, only the new updates contained in this package will be downloaded and installed on your device. 
For more information about security vulnerabilities, please refer to the new  
Security Update Guide 
 website and the  
May 2024 Security Updates 
. 
Known issues in this update 
Microsoft is not currently aware of any issues with this update. 
How to get this update 
Before installing this update 
Microsoft strongly recommends you install the latest servicing stack update (SSU) for your operating system before installing the latest cumulative update (LCU). SSUs improve the reliability of the update process to mitigate potential issues while installing the LCU and applying Microsoft security updates.  For general information about SSUs, see  
Servicing stack updates 
 and  
Servicing Stack Updates (SSU): Frequently Asked Questions 
. 
If you are using Windows Update, the latest SSU ( 
KB5037019 
) will be offered to you automatically. To get the standalone package for the latest SSU, search for it in the  
Microsoft Update Catalog 
.

summary:
KB5037788 is a quality improvement update released on May 14, 2024, for Windows 10 (OS Build 10240.20651). It addresses issues related to NTLM authentication traffic potentially affecting domain controllers and supports the currency change in Croatia from the kuna to the euro. No critical security vulnerabilities or bugs are reported for this update. Administrators are strongly encouraged to install the latest servicing stack update (SSU) prior to this cumulative update; specifically, SSU KB5037019 is recommended. The update is available through Windows Update, Microsoft Update Catalog, and WSUS.

**Technical Breakdown**

**Vulnerabilities and Exploits**:
- No high-impact or low-impact vulnerabilities are reported for this update; it primarily focuses on quality improvements.

**Installation Process and Prerequisites**:
1. **Prerequisites**: 
   - Install the latest servicing stack update (SSU) (KB5037019) before applying KB5037788.
   - Ensure systems are updated using the most recent quality updates for optimal security.

2. **Update Channels**:
   - Windows Update: The cumulative update will be automatically downloaded and installed.
   - Windows Update for Business: Automatically downloaded per organization’s policies.
   - Microsoft Update Catalog: For standalone package retrieval, search for KB5037788.
   - WSUS Configuration: Ensure the following is configured:
     ```
     [WSUS Configuration]
     Products: Windows 10
     Classifications: Security Updates
     ```

3. **SSU Installation Command**:
   ```
   [Powershell]
   ```powershell
   Get-WindowsUpdate -KBArticleID KB5037019 | Install-WindowsUpdate
   ```

4. **Standalone Update Installation**:
   - Download KB5037788 from the Microsoft Update Catalog for standalone installation as needed. 

There are no known issues associated with this particular update as per the current documentation.
